commitResults.messageTitle: Update project references and site-wide settings
commitResults.messageBody:
Replace references to AB3 with details of the current project to
personalize the documentation and website.

Acknowledge SE-EDU as the original source of the code

Update remaining README contents to reflect project specifics

Adjust navigation bar labels in site-wide configuration files

This ensures the project identity is consistent across the repository and
website, while giving proper credit to the original work.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add missing newline at end of _config.yml
commitResults.messageBody:
Fix formatting issue in docs/_config.yml by adding a newline at the end
of the file. This resolves the error raised during ./run-checks.sh and
ensures compliance with standard POSIX file conventions.
Update project references and site-wide settings

commitResults.messageTitle: Update build status badge link in README
commitResults.messageBody:
Change the GitHub Actions build status badge to point to the team
repository instead of the template. This ensures the badge accurately
reflects the build status of the current project.
Update build status badge link in README

commitResults.messageTitle: Update index markdown docs page to reflect current project

commitResults.messageBody: Update index markdown docs page to reflect current project
Add more NFR

commitResults.messageTitle: Update target users, value prop, stories
commitResults.messageBody:
Add project-specific audience, value proposition, and
user stories to the Developer Guide. The DG lacked these details or
used generic AB3 placeholders; align them to clarify scope and guide
development.
Add Use Cases to DG

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename AB3 packages and classes to match new product
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename existing AB3 package and class names to align with the new product
identity. Performing this refactoring early prevents widespread merge
conflicts with future feature branches.

This change improves project consistency and maintainability by ensuring
that naming reflects the current product scope and ownership.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add course tag display in UI for person's courses
commitResults.messageBody:
Display each course a person is enrolled in as a visual tag within the UI.
Courses are now sorted by their course code for consistent presentation.

This change improves readability and user experience by allowing users to
quickly view all courses associated with a person at a glance.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add SummaryCommand to show person and course breakdown
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement a new SummaryCommand that provides an overview of all persons
in the course book along with a breakdown of enrollments by course.

The command:

Counts the total number of persons in the course book

Groups and counts enrollments per course

Displays the results in a formatted summary message

This feature helps users quickly understand the overall distribution of
courses and student enrollments within the system.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add missing newline at end of DarkTheme.css

commitResults.messageBody:
Add unit/integration tests covering SummaryCommand’s output and model
effects to prevent regressions and document expected behavior.

Verify success message with populated course book

Verify empty model yields “No courses found”

Ensure model state remains unchanged after execution

These tests clarify the intended output format and person count handling,
providing confidence when refactoring summary logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add equality test for Person with different courses
Rehaul UI to Introduce Course-First View
commitResults.messageBody:
Shift the application's primary focus from person-centric to course-centric
interaction. The application now opens with a list of courses rather than
displaying all persons immediately.

Key updates:

Added a new course-centric startup behavior and view hierarchy

Introduced listcourses and viewcourse commands for course navigation

Modified list command to explicitly switch to person view

Implemented CourseListPanel and CourseCard UI components with FXML layouts

Extended Model and Logic interfaces to support course listing and filtering

Updated CommandResult with flags to control view switching

Adjusted MainWindow to support toggling between course and person views

Updated tests to handle new model methods and command behaviors

This rehaul provides a more structured, course-first workflow where users
navigate from an overview of courses into specific course details or the
complete person list, improving clarity and organization of the UI flow.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add missing newlines at EOF in FXML files
commitResults.messageBody:
Fix build errors caused by missing newline characters at the end of
CourseListCard.fxml and CourseListPanel.fxml.

Adding newlines ensures the files comply with POSIX formatting standards
and prevents linting or build processes from failing due to EOF issues.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add missing lines to improve code coverage
commitResults.messageBody:
Increase overall test coverage by adding missing lines and test cases in
logic, parser, model, and UI classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Further add missing lines to improve code coverage
Enhance Help Window with In-App Command Reference
commitResults.messageBody:
Transform the Help Window from a simple URL display into a comprehensive
in-app command reference with consistent placeholder syntax and improved
styling.

Key updates:

Added CommandSummary inner class to represent command metadata

Implemented initializeCommandTable() and populateCommandTable() to
display all 16 commands with names, descriptions, and examples

Updated HelpWindow.fxml with a scrollable, resizable table layout and
reorganized URL section

Overhauled HelpWindow.css with a modern dark theme and interactive
table styling

Created new unit tests (CommandSummaryTest, HelpWindowSimpleTest) to
validate command data, placeholders, and help message consistency

This enhancement improves usability by giving users immediate, structured
access to command syntax and examples directly within the application,
reducing reliance on external documentation while maintaining clarity and
visual consistency.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add missing newlines at EOF in css file
Enforce no-parameter rule for summary command
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the summary command accepted parameters, which was unintended
and inconsistent with the expected usage. This change ensures that the
summary command now rejects any input parameters.

If parameters are provided, the command outputs an error message indicating
an invalid command format. This makes command behavior clearer and prevents
user misuse.
Add Birthday Command
Bugfix/list by courses

Add missing import for Course and implement two stub methods in
ModelStubWithOnePerson to match updated Model interface. Ensure test
compiles correctly by providing minimal method implementations for
course-related functionality.

- Add import for seedu.coursebook.model.course.Course
- Implement getFilteredCourseList() to return empty list
- Implement updateFilteredCourseList(Predicate<Course>) as empty stub
Sort contacts by upcoming birthday
Fix View Switching Bug for sort and sortb Commands in HomeView
Fix wrong error messages for wrong tag in bday command
Fix list usage formatting issue

commitResults.messageTitle: Standardize course codes and name capitalization
commitResults.messageBody:
Ensure consistency and case-insensitivity in course codes and names

Updated Course.java to automatically convert course codes to uppercase

Makes course code matching case-insensitive

Ensures consistent internal representation

Updated Name.java to auto-capitalize names using new helper method

Formats names as “First Last” while preserving spacing

Ensures consistent display and comparison

Added CourseTest.java with comprehensive test coverage for new behaviors

Added NameTest.java tests for capitalization logic

Updated PersonTest.java to align with new name normalization behavior

These changes improve data consistency, user experience, and maintainability by
ensuring uniform handling of course codes and names across the application.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add command history navigation to CommandBox
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement terminal-style command history navigation using arrow keys

Updated CommandBox.java to support UP/DOWN arrow navigation

Added logic reference and history tracking fields

Implemented methods for navigating through command history

Preserved current user input when entering/exiting history mode

Reset navigation state after command execution

Modified MainWindow.java to pass Logic reference to CommandBox

Added CommandBoxTest.java with 23 comprehensive test cases covering:

Command history storage, navigation, and edge cases

Equality, immutability, and copy constructor behavior in CommandHistory

This feature enhances usability by allowing users to quickly recall and reuse
previously executed commands, improving workflow efficiency and aligning the
application with familiar terminal interaction patterns.
